p: Using a third strategy, we successfully generated a reporter influenza subtype H3N2 virus NY-r19-Gluc, which is a 6:2 genetic reassortant encoding the HA and NA genes of the NY virus in a backbone comprising the six internal genes of PR8, where a Gluc gene is fused to the NS segment as previously described [ 28]. Although slightly attenuated compared to wildtype virus, the reassortant virus is replication-competent and stable in vitro; furthermore, the expression level of Gluc protein can be used to monitor virus replication accurately ( Figure 3 and Figure 4).
